marketplaces.name: agent-toolkit
marketplaces.description: Skills, agents, and commands for AI coding agents - individually selectable
marketplaces.repo_description: A curated collection of skills for AI coding agents. Skills are packaged instructions and scripts that extend agent capabilities across development, documentation, planning, and professional workflows.

files..claude-plugin/marketplace.json:
{
  "name": "agent-toolkit",
  "owner": {
    "name": "softaworks",
    "url": "https://github.com/softaworks"
  },
  "metadata": {
    "description": "Skills, agents, and commands for AI coding agents - individually selectable",
    "version": "1.0.9"
  },
  "plugins": [
    {
      "name": "codex",
      "description": "Use when the user asks to run Codex CLI (codex exec, codex resume) or references OpenAI Codex for code analysis, refactoring, or automated editing. Uses GPT-5.2 by default for state-of-the-art software engineering.",
      "source": "./dist/plugins/codex",
      "strict": false,
      "skills": [
        "./skills/codex"
      ],
      "category": "ai-tools",
      "keywords": [
        "ai",
        "code-analysis",
        "gpt",
        "codex",
        "openai"
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "gemini",
      "description": "Use when the user asks to run Gemini CLI for code review, plan review, or big context (>200k) processing. Ideal for comprehensive analysis requiring large context windows. Uses Gemini 3 Pro by default for state-of-the-art reasoning and coding.",
      "source": "./dist/plugins/gemini",
      "strict": false,
      "skills": [
        "./skills/gemini"
      ],
      "category": "ai-tools",
      "keywords": [
        "ai",
        "code-review",
        "large-context",
        "gemini",
        "google"
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "perplexity",
      "description": "Web search and research using Perplexity AI. Use when user says 'search', 'find', 'look up', 'ask', 'research', or 'what's the latest' for generic queries.",
      "source": "./dist/plugins/perplexity",
      "strict": false,
      "skills": [
        "./skills/perplexity"
      ],
      "category": "ai-tools",
      "keywords": [
        "ai",
        "search",
        "research",
        "perplexity"
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "agent-md-refactor",
      "description": "Refactor bloated AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, or similar agent instruction files to follow progressive disclosure principles. Splits monolithic files into organized, linked documentation.",
      "source": "./dist/plugins/agent-md-refactor",
      "strict": false,
      "skills": [
        "./skills/agent-md-refactor"
      ],
      "category": "meta",
      "keywords": [
        "meta",
        "refactor",
        "claude-md",
        "agents-md",
        "documentation"
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "command-creator",
      "description": "Create Claude Code slash commands. Use when users ask to 'create a command', 'make a slash command', 'add a command', or want to document a workflow as a reusable command.",
      "source": "./dist/plugins/command-creator",
      "strict": false,
      "skills": [
        "./skills/command-creator"
      ],
      "category": "meta",
      "keywords": [
        "meta",
        "commands",
        "slash-commands",
        "claude-code"
      ]
    },
    {
      "name": "plugin-forge",
      "description": "Create and manage Claude Code plugins with proper structure, manifests, and marketplace integration. Use when creating plugins for a marketplace, adding plugin components (commands, agents, hooks), bumping plugin versions, or working with plugin.json/marketplace.json manifests.",
      "source": "./dist/plugins/plugin-forge",
      "strict": false,
      "skills": [
        "./skills/plugin-forge"
      ],
      "category": "meta",
      "keywords": [
        "meta",
        "plugins",
        "marketplace",
        "claude-code"
      ]
    },
    {

files.README.md:
# Softaworks Agent Skills

Opinionated skills shared by [@leonardocouy](https://github.com/leonardocouy) for improving daily work efficiency with Claude Code. Skills are packaged instructions and scripts that extend agent capabilities across development, documentation, planning, and professional workflows.

Skills follow the [Agent Skills](https://agentskills.io/) format.

---

## ðŸ§­ Quick Navigation

**[ðŸš€ Installation](#-installation)** â€¢ **[ðŸ“š Available Skills](#-available-skills)** â€¢ **[ðŸ¤– Agents & Commands](#-agents--commands)** â€¢ **[ðŸ“– Skill Structure](#-skill-structure)** â€¢ **[ðŸ¤ Contributing](#-contributing)** â€¢ **[ðŸ“„ License](#-license)** â€¢ **[ðŸ”— Links](#-links)**

---

## ðŸš€ Installation

### Quick Install (Recommended)

```bash
npx skills add softaworks/agent-toolkit
```

This method works with multiple AI coding agents (Claude Code, Codex, Cursor, etc.)

### Register as Plugin Marketplace

Run the following commands in Claude Code:

```bash
/plugin marketplace add softaworks/agent-toolkit
/plugin
```

### Install Plugins

**Option 1: Via Browse UI**

1. Switch to **Marketplaces** tab (use arrow keys or Tab)
2. Select **agent-toolkit**, press Enter
3. Browse and select the plugin(s) you want to install
4. Select **Install now**

**Option 2: Direct Install**

```bash
# Install specific skill
/plugin install codex@agent-toolkit
/plugin install humanizer@agent-toolkit

# Install specific agent
/plugin install agent-codebase-pattern-finder@agent-toolkit

# Install specific command
/plugin install command-codex-plan@agent-toolkit
```

**Option 3: Ask the Agent**

Simply tell Claude Code:

> Please install Skills from github.com/softaworks/agent-toolkit

### Available Plugins

Each skill, agent, and command is an individual plugin that can be installed separately:

- **Skills** â†’ See [Available Skills](#-available-skills) for the full list
- **Agents** â†’ See [Agents](#agents) (install as `agent-<name>@agent-toolkit`)
- **Commands** â†’ See [Slash Commands](#slash-commands) (install as `command-<name>@agent-toolkit`)

### Update Plugins

To update plugins to the latest version:

1. Run `/plugin` in Claude Code
2. Switch to **Marketplaces** tab
3. Select **agent-toolkit**
4. Choose **Update marketplace**

You can also **Enable auto-update** to get the latest versions automatically.

### Manual Installation

**For Claude Code (Manual)** â€” Skills only
```bash
cp -r skills/<skill-name> ~/.claude/skills/
```

**For claude.ai** â€” Skills only

Add skills to project knowledge or paste SKILL.md contents into the conversation.

---

## ðŸ“š Available Skills

| Category | Skill | Description |
|----------|-------|-------------|
| ðŸ¤– AI Tools | [codex](skills/codex/README.md) | Advanced code analysis with GPT-5.2 |
| ðŸ¤– AI Tools | [gemini](skills/gemini/README.md) | Large-scale review (200k+ context) |
| ðŸ¤– AI Tools | [perplexity](skills/perplexity/README.md) | Web search & research |
| ðŸ”® Meta | [agent-md-refactor](skills/agent-md-refactor/README.md) | Refactor bloated agent instruction files |
| ðŸ”® Meta | [command-creator](skills/command-creator/README.md) | Create Claude Code slash commands |
| ðŸ”® Meta | [plugin-forge](skills/plugin-forge/README.md) | Build Claude Code plugins & manifests |
| ðŸ”® Meta | [skill-judge](skills/skill-judge/README.md) | Evaluate skill design quality |
| ðŸ“ Documentation | [backend-to-frontend-handoff-docs](skills/backend-to-frontend-handoff-docs/README.md) | API handoff docs for frontend |
| ðŸ“ Documentation | [c4-architecture](skills/c4-architecture/README.md) | C4 architecture diagrams with Mermaid |
| ðŸ“ Documentation | [crafting-effective-readmes](skills/crafting-effective-readmes/README.md) | Write effective README files |
| ðŸ“ Documentation | [draw-io](skills/draw-io/README.md) | Create & edit draw.io diagrams |
| ðŸ“ Documentation | [excalidraw](skills/excalidraw/README.md) | Work with Excalidraw diagrams |
| ðŸ“ Documentation | [frontend-to-backend-requirements](skills/frontend-to-backend-requirements/README.md) | Document API requirements |
| ðŸ“ Documentation | [marp-slide](skills/marp-slide/README.md) | Professional presentation slides |
| ðŸ“ Documentation | [mermaid-diagrams](skills/mermaid-diagrams/README.md) | Software diagrams with Mermaid |
| ðŸ“ Documentation | [writing-clearly-and-concisely](skills/writing-clearly-and-concisely/README.md) | Clear, professional writing |
| ðŸŽ¨ Design & Frontend | [design-system-starter](skills/design-system-starter/README.md) | Create design systems |
| ðŸŽ¨ Design & Frontend | [mui](skills/mui/README.md) | Material-UI v7 patterns |
| ðŸŽ¨ Design & Frontend | [openapi-to-typescript](skills/openapi-to-typescript/README.md) | Convert OpenAPI to TypeScript |
| ðŸŽ¨ Design & Frontend | [react-dev](skills/react-dev/README.md) | Type-safe React 18-19 with TypeScript |
| ðŸŽ¨ Design & Frontend | [react-useeffect](skills/react-useeffect/README.md) | React useEffect best practices |
| ðŸ› ï¸ Development | [database-schema-designer](skills/database-schema-designer/README.md) | Design robust database schemas |
| ðŸ› ï¸ Development | [dependency-updater](skills/dependency-updater/README.md) | Smart dependency management |
| ðŸ› ï¸ Development | [naming-analyzer](skills/naming-analyzer/README.md) | Suggest better variable/function names |
| ðŸ› ï¸ Development | [reducing-entropy](skills/reducing-entropy/README.md) | Minimize codebase size |
| ðŸ› ï¸ Development | [session-handoff](skills/session-handoff/README.md) | Seamless AI session transfers |
| ðŸŽ¯ Planning | [game-changing-features](skills/game-changing-features/README.md) | Find 10x product opportunities |
| ðŸŽ¯ Planning | [gepetto](skills/gepetto/README.md) | Detailed implementation planning |
| ðŸŽ¯ Planning | [requirements-clarity](skills/requirements-clarity/README.md) | Clarify requirements before coding |
| ðŸŽ¯ Planning | [ship-learn-next](skills/ship-learn-next/README.md) | Turn learning into actionable reps |
| ðŸ‘” Professional | [daily-meeting-update](skills/daily-meeting-update/README.md) | Interactive daily standup generator |
| ðŸ‘” Professional | [difficult-workplace-conversations](skills/difficult-workplace-conversations/README.md) | Navigate difficult conversations |
| ðŸ‘” Professional | [feedback-mastery](skills/feedback-mastery/README.md) | Deliver constructive feedback |
| ðŸ‘” Professional | [professional-communication](skills/professional-communication/README.md) | Technical communication guide |
| ðŸ§ª Testing | [qa-test-planner](skills/qa-test-planner/README.md) | Comprehensive QA test planning |
| ðŸ“¦ Git | [commit-work](skills/commit-work/README.md) | High-quality git commits |
| ðŸ”§ Utilities | [datadog-cli](skills/datadog-cli/README.md) | Debug with Datadog logs & metrics |
| ðŸ”§ Utilities | [domain-name-brainstormer](skills/domain-name-brainstormer/README.md) | Generate & check domain names |
| ðŸ”§ Utilities | [humanizer](skills/humanizer/README.md) | Remove AI writing patterns |
| ðŸ”§ Utilities | [meme-factory](skills/meme-factory/README.md) | Generate memes with API |
| ðŸ”§ Utilities | [jira](skills/jira/README.md) | Natural language Jira interaction |
| ðŸ”§ Utilities | [web-to-markdown](skills/web-to-markdown/README.md) | Convert webpages to Markdown |

---

## ðŸ¤– Agents & Commands

> **Requires [Claude Code CLI](https://docs.anthropic.com/claude-code)** â€” These agents and commands are exclusive to Claude Code users.
>
> For full access, add the marketplace and install plugins:
> ```bash
> /plugin marketplace add softaworks/agent-toolkit
> /plugin install codex@agent-toolkit
> ```

### Agents

Specialized sub-agents that Claude Code can delegate tasks to:

| Agent | Description |
|-------|-------------|
| ascii-ui-mockup-generator | Visualize UI concepts through ASCII mockups |
| codebase-pattern-finder | Find similar implementations and patterns |
| communication-excellence-coach | Email refinement, tone calibration, roleplay |
| general-purpose | Default agent for complex multi-step tasks |
| mermaid-diagram-specialist | Create flowcharts, sequence diagrams, ERDs |
| ui-ux-designer | Research-backed UI/UX design feedback |

### Slash Commands

Reusable workflows invoked with `/command-name`:

| Command | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `/codex-plan` | Create implementation plans using Codex 5.2 |
| `/compose-email` | Draft professional emails |
| `/explain-changes-mental-model` | Build mental model of code changes |
| `/explain-pr-changes` | Generate PR summaries |
| `/sync-branch` | Sync feature branch with main |
| `/sync-skills-readme` | Update README skills table |
| `/viral-tweet` | Optimize tweet ideas for X engagement |

---

## ðŸ“– Skill Structure

Each skill contains:
- `SKILL.md` - Detailed instructions for the agent (with YAML frontmatter)
- `README.md` - User-friendly documentation with examples
- `scripts/` - Helper scripts for automation (optional)
- `references/` - Supporting documentation (optional)

---

## ðŸ¤ Contributing

Contributions are welcome! When adding new skills:

1. Follow the [Agent Skills](https://agentskills.io/) format
2. Include both `SKILL.md` (for agents) and `README.md` (for users)
3. Add YAML frontmatter to `SKILL.md` with `name:` and `description:` fields
4. Update this README.md with a link to your skill

---

## ðŸ“„ License

MIT

---

## ðŸ”— Links

- [Agent Skills Format](https://agentskills.io/)
- [Claude Code Documentation](https://docs.anthropic.com/claude/docs)
- [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/softaworks/agent-toolkit)

plugins.name: codex
plugins.description: Use when the user asks to run Codex CLI (codex exec, codex resume) or references OpenAI Codex for code analysis, refactoring, or automated editing. Uses GPT-5.2 by default for state-of-the-art software engineering.

plugins.name: gemini
plugins.description: Use when the user asks to run Gemini CLI for code review, plan review, or big context (>200k) processing. Ideal for comprehensive analysis requiring large context windows. Uses Gemini 3 Pro by default for state-of-the-art reasoning and coding.

plugins.name: perplexity
plugins.description: Web search and research using Perplexity AI. Use when user says 'search', 'find', 'look up', 'ask', 'research', or 'what's the latest' for generic queries.

plugins.name: agent-md-refactor
plugins.description: Refactor bloated AGENTS.md, CLAUDE.md, or similar agent instruction files to follow progressive disclosure principles. Splits monolithic files into organized, linked documentation.

plugins.name: command-creator
plugins.description: Create Claude Code slash commands. Use when users ask to 'create a command', 'make a slash command', 'add a command', or want to document a workflow as a reusable command.

plugins.name: plugin-forge
plugins.description: Create and manage Claude Code plugins with proper structure, manifests, and marketplace integration. Use when creating plugins for a marketplace, adding plugin components (commands, agents, hooks), bumping plugin versions, or working with plugin.json/marketplace.json manifests.

plugins.name: skill-judge
plugins.description: Evaluate Agent Skill design quality against official specifications and best practices. Use when reviewing, auditing, or improving SKILL.md files and skill packages.

plugins.name: backend-to-frontend-handoff-docs
plugins.description: Create API handoff documentation for frontend developers. Use when backend work is complete and needs to be documented for frontend integration.

plugins.name: c4-architecture
plugins.description: Generate architecture documentation using C4 model Mermaid diagrams. Use when asked to create architecture diagrams, document system architecture, visualize software structure.

plugins.name: crafting-effective-readmes
plugins.description: Use when writing or improving README files. Provides templates and guidance matched to your audience and project type.

plugins.name: draw-io
plugins.description: draw.io diagram creation, editing, and review. Use for .drawio XML editing, PNG conversion, layout adjustment, and AWS icon usage.

plugins.name: excalidraw
plugins.description: Use when working with *.excalidraw or *.excalidraw.json files, user mentions diagrams/flowcharts, or requests architecture visualization.

plugins.name: frontend-to-backend-requirements
plugins.description: Document frontend data needs for backend developers. Use when frontend needs to communicate API requirements to backend.

plugins.name: marp-slide
plugins.description: Create professional Marp presentation slides with 7 beautiful themes. Use when users request slide creation, presentations, or Marp documents.

plugins.name: mermaid-diagrams
plugins.description: Comprehensive guide for creating software diagrams using Mermaid syntax. Use when users need to create, visualize, or document software through diagrams.

plugins.name: writing-clearly-and-concisely
plugins.description: Use when writing prose humans will readâ€”documentation, commit messages, error messages, explanations, reports, or UI text.

plugins.name: design-system-starter
plugins.description: Create and evolve design systems with design tokens, component architecture, accessibility guidelines, and documentation templates.

plugins.name: mui
plugins.description: Material-UI v7 component library patterns including sx prop styling, theme integration, responsive design, and MUI-specific hooks.

plugins.name: openapi-to-typescript
plugins.description: Converts OpenAPI 3.0 JSON/YAML to TypeScript interfaces and type guards. Use when generating types from OpenAPI or creating API interfaces.

plugins.name: react-dev
plugins.description: Build React components with TypeScript. Covers type-safe patterns for React 18-19 including generic components, proper event typing, and routing integration.

plugins.name: react-useeffect
plugins.description: React useEffect best practices from official docs. Use when writing/reviewing useEffect, useState for derived values, data fetching, or state synchronization. Teaches when NOT to use Effect and better alternatives.

plugins.name: database-schema-designer
plugins.description: Design robust, scalable database schemas for SQL and NoSQL databases. Provides normalization guidelines, indexing strategies, migration patterns.

plugins.name: dependency-updater
plugins.description: Smart dependency management for any language. Auto-detects project type, applies safe updates automatically, prompts for major versions.

plugins.name: naming-analyzer
plugins.description: Suggest better variable, function, and class names based on context and conventions.

plugins.name: reducing-entropy
plugins.description: Manual-only skill for minimizing total codebase size. Only activate when explicitly requested. Measures success by final code amount.

plugins.name: session-handoff
plugins.description: Creates comprehensive handoff documents for seamless AI agent session transfers. Use when context window approaches capacity or work session is ending.

plugins.name: game-changing-features
plugins.description: Find 10x product opportunities and high-leverage improvements. Use when user wants strategic product thinking or wants to find high-impact features.

plugins.name: gepetto
plugins.description: Creates detailed, sectionized implementation plans through research, stakeholder interviews, and multi-LLM review. Use when planning features that need thorough pre-implementation analysis.

plugins.name: requirements-clarity
plugins.description: Clarify ambiguous requirements through focused dialogue before implementation. Use when requirements are unclear or features are complex.

plugins.name: ship-learn-next
plugins.description: Transform learning content (like YouTube transcripts, articles, tutorials) into actionable implementation plans using the Ship-Learn-Next framework.

plugins.name: difficult-workplace-conversations
plugins.description: Structured approach to workplace conflicts, performance discussions, and challenging feedback using preparation-delivery-followup framework.

plugins.name: feedback-mastery
plugins.description: Navigate difficult conversations and deliver constructive feedback using structured frameworks. Covers the Preparation-Delivery-Follow-up model and Situation-Behavior-Impact (SBI) technique.

plugins.name: daily-meeting-update
plugins.description: Interactive daily standup/meeting update generator. Use when user says 'daily', 'standup', 'scrum update', 'status update', or wants to prepare for daily meeting. Conducts interview (yesterday, today, blockers, discussion topics) and optionally pulls activity from GitHub/git/Jira if available and approved by user.

plugins.name: professional-communication
plugins.description: Guide technical communication for software developers. Covers email structure, team messaging etiquette, meeting agendas, and adapting messages for technical vs non-technical audiences.

plugins.name: qa-test-planner
plugins.description: Generate comprehensive test plans, manual test cases, regression test suites, and bug reports for QA engineers.

plugins.name: commit-work
plugins.description: Create high-quality git commits: review/stage intended changes, split into logical commits, and write clear commit messages (including Conventional Commits).

plugins.name: datadog-cli
plugins.description: Datadog CLI for searching logs, querying metrics, tracing requests, and managing dashboards. Use when debugging production issues or working with Datadog observability.

plugins.name: domain-name-brainstormer
plugins.description: Generates creative domain name ideas for your project and checks availability across multiple TLDs (.com, .io, .dev, .ai, etc.).

plugins.name: humanizer
plugins.description: Remove signs of AI-generated writing from text. Use when editing or reviewing text to make it sound more natural and human-written.

plugins.name: meme-factory
plugins.description: Generate memes using the memegen.link API. Use when users request memes, want to add humor to content, or need visual aids for social media.

plugins.name: web-to-markdown
plugins.description: Converts webpage URLs to clean Markdown by calling the local web2md CLI (Puppeteer + Readability), suitable for JS-rendered pages.

plugins.name: jira
plugins.description: Use when the user mentions Jira issues (e.g., "PROJ-123"), asks about tickets, wants to create/view/update issues, check sprint status, or manage their Jira workflow. Triggers on keywords like "jira", "issue", "ticket", "sprint", "backlog", or issue key patterns.

plugins.name: agent-ascii-ui-mockup-generator
plugins.description: Visualize UI concepts through ASCII mockups before implementation. Creates multiple ASCII mockup variations for dashboard layouts, forms, and other UI components.

plugins.name: agent-codebase-pattern-finder
plugins.description: Find similar implementations, usage examples, or existing patterns in the codebase. Provides concrete code examples based on what you're looking for.

plugins.name: agent-communication-excellence-coach
plugins.description: Review communication drafts or prepare difficult conversations. Provides email refinement, tone calibration, roleplay practice, and presentation feedback.

plugins.name: agent-general-purpose
plugins.description: Default agent for handling complex, multi-step tasks with automatic delegation capabilities.

plugins.name: agent-mermaid-diagram-specialist
plugins.description: Mermaid diagram specialist for creating flowcharts, sequence diagrams, ERDs, and architecture visualizations.

plugins.name: agent-ui-ux-designer
plugins.description: Expert UI/UX design critic and advisor who provides research-backed, opinionated feedback on interfaces. Pushes back on bad ideas and cites sources.

plugins.name: command-codex-plan
plugins.description: Create a detailed implementation plan using Codex 5.2 with high reasoning.

plugins.name: command-compose-email
plugins.description: Draft a professional email using the What-Why-How framework. Use when composing emails to colleagues, stakeholders, or leadership.

plugins.name: command-explain-changes-mental-model
plugins.description: Build a mental model of changes by splitting them into smaller logical chunks.

plugins.name: command-explain-pr-changes
plugins.description: Generate comprehensive markdown summary of pull request changes with visual impact analysis.

plugins.name: command-sync-branch
plugins.description: Sync feature branch with the latest main branch.

plugins.name: command-sync-skills-readme
plugins.description: Sync root README.md with current skills inventory from skills/ directory.

plugins.name: command-viral-tweet
plugins.description: Transform a raw tweet idea into an optimized viral post for X. Analyzes engagement drivers and generates 3 optimized versions with posting strategy.
